results.firPara: In an age of single-striker systems Zlatan Ibrahimovics Premier League goal drought may have already ended Manchester Uniteds title hopes. This is the stark truth of the one-up-top ploy adopted by those with championship pretensions the centre-forward has to deliver in most games.
results.secPara: Ibrahimovic is not doing so. He last scored in the league five weeks ago and José Mourinhos side are eight points from the summit after 10 matches.
results.webTitle: Zlatan Ibrahimovic embodies Manchester United’s woes – is it time to drop him?

results.firPara: Mauricio Pochettino says that Harry Kane will play no part in Tottenham Hotspurs Champions League tie against Bayer Leverkusen on Wednesday night but he suggested that he could return for the derby at Arsenal on Sunday.
results.secPara: The Tottenham manager also reported that Toby Alderweireld would not feature against Leverkusen and it sounded doubtful that he would be back for Arsenal while Erik Lamela is out with a hip problem.
results.webTitle: Harry Kane could return for Tottenham in Arsenal derby

results.firPara: Miroslav Klose, the top scorer in World Cup history, is ending his playing career and will join Joachim Löws coaching staff as he studies for his pro licence, the German football association (DFB) have confirmed.
results.secPara: The 38-year-old retired from international football after winning the World Cup with Germany in 2014, scoring twice to bring his total goal tally from four tournaments to 16. He is also Germanys record scorer with 71 goals.
results.webTitle: Miroslav Klose confirms retirement and joins Germany coaching staff

results.firPara: Frank de Boer has been sacked as head coach at Internazionale following the teams latest defeat to Sampdoria on Sunday evening.
results.secPara: The Dutchman, who was appointed in August, has lost seven of his 14 games in charge. The youth team coach Stefano Vecchi will be in charge when the side travel to take on Southampton in the Europa League on Thursday.
results.webTitle: Internazionale sack head coach Frank de Boer after two months in charge

results.firPara: Todays fluff is turning cartwheels cross the floor
results.secPara: Todays fluff is turning cartwheels cross the floor
results.webTitle: Football transfer rumours: Chelsea to let Cesc Fàbregas leave on loan?

results.firPara: Disputes over pay mean that the NWSL is struggling to keep hold of top international talent
results.secPara: On the field, the US womens soccer team has followed up a thrilling NWSL final with a couple of smashing debuts in friendlies against Switzerland. Off the field, the sport is bogged down in the courts and at the negotiating table.
results.webTitle: How turmoil in US women's soccer could drive players to Europe

results.firPara: One of Ronald Koemans first acts as the Everton manager in June was the calculated risk of a phone call to Romelu Lukaku. Youre going nowhere, was the gist of the conversation with the striker with undisguised ambitions of Champions League football. Koeman got his calculations correct.
results.secPara: Lukakus latest goal, against West Ham United on Sunday, brought up his half-century for Everton in the Premier League and underscored his importance to Koemans ambitions at Goodison Park. The 23-year-old has scored seven and assisted three of Evertons 15 league goals this season, equalling his best start to a Premier League campaign after 10 games, and credits clear direction from the new manager with an all-round improvement to his game.
results.webTitle: Romelu Lukaku rewards Ronald Koeman’s direction with starring role

results.firPara: Never mind a wet midweek test at Stoke City, this was a Halloween which ended with Swansea City given the lasting fright of a defeat that leaves them second bottom and five points from safety.
results.secPara: For Stoke a third consecutive win lifts them to 12th position and suddenly they are looking up following a barren beginning. They made it nine points from nine thanks to a second-half own-goal from Alfie Mawson and Wilfried Bonys second of the match.
results.webTitle: Wilfried Bony returns to spook brittle Swansea with first Stoke goals

results.firPara: Stoke rose to 12th place thanks to their third consecutive win, while Swansea remained 19th despite a spirited performance
results.secPara: Thats your lot! Stoke rise all the way to 12th place after their third consecutive win. Swansea remain in 19th place and its increasingly looking like a season of struggle for them. Theyve won one of their first 10 matches. At least Sunderland exist. Thanks for reading. Bye.
results.webTitle: Stoke v Swansea: Premier League – as it happened

results.firPara: Olivier Giroud hopes to stake a claim for greater involvement at Arsenal by impressing on his first start of the season against Ludogorets Razgrad on Tuesday. The France international is convinced his turn will come after a slow start to his campaign.
results.secPara: The striker returned to training late after helping France reach the final of Euro 2016 and, after his cameo against Paris Saint-Germain at Parc des Princes was curtailed by a red card, saw his progress further disrupted by a niggling toe injury aggravated on international duty. Giroud came off the bench at Sunderland to score with his first two touches in Saturdays 4-1 victory – his first goals of the season – and is expected to start against the Bulgarians at the Vasil Levski stadium as Arsenal seek to extend their involvement in the competition beyond Christmas for a 17th consecutive season.
results.webTitle: Olivier Giroud ready to seize Arsenal moment as Wenger looks long-term
